org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint
Class RangeConstraint<C,D>

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint.BaseConstraint
      org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint.RangeConstraint<C,D>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Constraint
Direct Known Subclasses:
DateRangeConstraint, StringRangeConstraint
public class RangeConstraint<C,D>
extends BaseConstraint

Given two form elements, it checks that their values are one after another. It assumes that the values of both form elements are of the same type and Comparable (so most data types should be supported, including String and Date).

Author:
Konstantin Tretyakov
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

RangeConstraint

public RangeConstraint(FormElement<C,D> fieldLo,
                       FormElement<C,D> fieldHi,
                       boolean allowEquals)
Creates a new range constraint that checks that form field values are in the right order: the fieldLo is less than fieldHi. It is possible to specify through allowEquals whether the values may be equal or not.

Parameters:
fieldLo - The value of this field is checked to be less than the value of fieldHi (or null)
fieldHi - The value of this field is checked to be greater than the value of fieldLo (or null)
allowEquals - If this is true, the constraint will be considered satisfied when values of fieldLo and fieldHi are equal. Otherwise the constraint won't be satisfied in this case.
Method Detail

validateConstraint

protected void validateConstraint()
Makes sure that either any of the form elements has a null value, or the low field value is less then high field value.

Specified by:
validateConstraint in class BaseConstraint

addErrorMessage

protected void addErrorMessage()
Adds an error message that the data did not fulfill the range constraint.

resolveLocale

Resolves the current locale.
